If you have an Sales or Service Hub Enterprise Account maybe a graphql search would help. 

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/cms/content/data-driven-content/graphql/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql?__hstc=153112167.c4a577029c49e44b73bd3bee6fa38565.1730764800152.1730764800153.1730764800154.1&__hssc=153112167.1.1730764800155&__hsfp=1169088524|https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/cms/content/data-driven-content/graphql/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql?__hstc=153112167.c4a577029c49e44b73bd3bee6fa38565.1730764800152.1730764800153.1730764800154.1&__hssc=153112167.1.1730764800155&__hsfp=1169088524>
Hi, i can't find the HubSpot API on my Account
Can anyone help me?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/understanding-the-crm>

and to use them you need either a public or private app.

for test and start I would recommend a private app :)
Could it be the browser that caches the previous request and prevents the new request to be send? As the call are identical, it may be the browser the problem...

In the web page doing the Api call, by setting the cache control to NoCache, it seems to resolve the problem. :confused:
I hope it shall help someone else. :sweat_smile:

I have this case, we will send an email campaign to update customer data.
I have thought about using the HubSpot API to query the data of a specific list and display it in the form fields, users will be able to update the fields and send.
Has anyone done something similar? Do you have an example?

hi , i need some help .
does anybody know if i can prepopulate these values with my deal owner info ?
im talking about the quote sender info , theres a api end point ?

Hi, Guys! Would it be possible to use regex to search for values within filterGroups in the search API for deals, instead of just using a string? I know there's the CONTAINS_TOKEN operator, but it only works with strings. I'm looking for a way to perform a search using regex in the search.
You need to create a private app first, then you get your API key.
You find this in settings, under the integrations tab.
dont think so sadly

Hi there - is there a way via `HubSpotClient` to search for a HubSpot user by their email address?  I have the email address of the user and I need to set them as the Ticket Collaborator, so I have to find the HubSpot ID that corresponds to their email.

Looks like I might be able to do it using REST, but is the function exposed in the `@HubSpot/api-client`

Hey! :wave: I’ve been searching the docs and forms for quite a while, but have not come up with a solution to a problem I am having with the `hs_created_by` property after creating a call via the v3 batch calls create endpoint ``/crm/v3/objects/calls/batch/create`` . Basically, I would expect HubSpot to auto-fill this property, but it is not reflected on the call object. When retrieving the call, we see `hs_created_by=null` . Also, on the call table in the HubSpot UI, the “Activity created by” col says “No user”.

The calls do log with the correct `HubSpot_owner_id`. Does anyone know why the `hs_created_by` property would not be set?

Thanks so much!

Can anyone confirm if its possible to fetch/update a line item by custom id property? The docs seem to imply that you can but Ive tried and tried to no avail. I can use a search but not a direct ID fetch.  For one the prop has to be created using API to get a unique value as that option doesnt exist in the UI for products. Secondly for search to work it cannot be hidden. I seem to recall in the past that it had to be available in the global search to work as a custom ID field but I dont see a way to set that using the API. A bit baffled
This isn't working for you? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/objects/line-items#patch-%2Fcrm%2Fv3%2Fobjects%2Fline_items%2F%7Blineitemid%7D>

No. Update or read do not work for me. It may be the property but not sure what to do. I seem to recall when I did a custom ID that it needed to be both unique and global searchable. there is no option at all in UI to male a prop like that for products/line items and if I do the prop using the API I can do unique but I see no trace of the global search field (which doesnt show  up if I fetch props of an existing field so not sure).

I don't know all your specifics but here are somethings you might find useful.

1.) Line items are instances of a product from the product object
2.). Line items are associated to Deals only
3.) If you can find the Deal ID you can make a GET request and include associations = line_items. The response will include the line_item IDs associated to the Deal.

thats the approach I am using. I fetch the deal associated items, map my custom ID field to those to get the HS id so I can then perform updates and deletes. Its messy and dirty but got it working. Id sure like to know though if the docs are wrong or if there is something I am missing

Hey everyone,

Just following up on my previous post regarding the issue with tracking Google and Facebook leads after the recent API shift. We haven't received any feedback yet and would really appreciate your insights or suggestions on how to resolve this. Has anyone else faced similar issues or found a workaround?

Also, is there a *Discord* community for HubSpot? If so, please let us know.

Thanks in advance for your help!
Seems the correct approach although I don't understand your need for a custom ID
